Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms and disappointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: freeicetea
Reviews.Content: My mother and I started in a twin room for a weekend away. The room was very well decorated and very clean but very cramped, we has to shimmy around each other all the time. The location us fantastic the earls court tube is at the top of the road and the area is nice with a few pubs and restaurants. The breakfast was disappointing because there was no museli even though it was on the breakfast options and we requested it every morning we stayed. we were told it wasn't I'm yet every day. Hot breakfasts.are an extra cost. I waited until the last day to get it as a treat. I had beans waffle and scrambled egg. The beans were microwaved in the same bowl that was given to me and looked yuck, the waffle was a toasted birds eye potato waffle and the egg was very watery. The cost of the ingredients must be 1.50 approx and the effort was minimum so why it cost me 4.20 I don't know. Great location, charming small hotel but avoid ordering hot breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: Cairon B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff were very pleasant. The room we stayed in though, was more like a cupboard than a double room. There was just enough room for a double bed, and I don't even think it was a full size double bed. As the room was so small, it was also very hot, even with the heating turned off and the window open. Breakfast was OK, but there was the same problem with moving around, the tables were too close together and as it was a buffet breakfast, everyone was moving around in the very small breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Food4thoughtuk
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed in this hotel. It'slocation for both Earls Court and the Tube is great. Its quite a nice quirky place, considering we didnt pay London prices Â£65 for a double room with continental breakfast! Yes the room was a bit on the small side but it was clean and tidy and had all the things you expect to find and the bed was comfy. The ensuite was compact but again clean and tidy with fresh towels and an asortment of shower products. Staff were pleasent and courteous and not in your face which was really nice. The Continental Breakfast was really good, aranged on a serve yourself basis with tea, coffee, juices, toast, rolls and croissant, cereal, fruit, ham, cheese and even some salad which made a refreshing change. Check out was friendly and like I noted earlier you get what you pay for which suited us fine!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay in "Family Room"--False Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNila
Reviews.Content: I went to London for a weekend trip with three of my girlfriends, and after reading good reviews, comparing prices, and researching the location, we decided to stay at the Mayflower Hotel. The outside of the building is very pretty as is the check in desk and lounge area. We were shocked when we opened the door to our room to see a tiny room with what they called a double bed made into a bunkbed. We were fine with having a bunkbed, but the "double" bed was barely bigger than a twin bed that had to be shared between two women. We were expecting two double beds like the pictures shown online. Overall, the room was not desirable at all, especially because of paper thin walls. We woke up throughout the night because of loud noises above us. We found out later it was a water pump, but the front desk personnel basically took it as a joke. Luckily we didn't hear any noises the second night. On the other hand, the location was good--just around the corner from the underground tube and within walking distance of many restaurants (recommendation: Gourmet Burger Kitchen)

Reviews.Title: “good if you get the right room type”
Reviews.Author: Netski66
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here 3 times in quick succession before on a work trip and on the 3rd trip I finally got the room type right (executive double ensuite @ GBP129/night incl breakfast). The previous 2 rooms were so small you could almost not move in them, let alone open a suitcase - and I was alone! This time I was with my husband and we got the same room - spacious with big windows that open high up over the street and a modern (if weird - who invents such crazy taps?!) bathroom that's a sort of 'glass box ensuite' on the right hand side of the room. The desk staff are friendly and and quite helpful and the location (a few minutes' walk from the Earls Court tube which is on the District, Circle & Piccadilly Lines) is very handy. The basement breakfast can be a little noisy and crowded but it's good value and pretty good quality. The worst thing about the hotel is that the lift is TINY and super slow, and the hallways are a narrow maze. I found it too easy to get lost and not know which way to go.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience”
Reviews.Author: carmita d
Reviews.Content: It was a truly nigthmare. Only after 2 days of insistent requests, the manager decided refund us the rest of the daily rates, that was paid in full at check in (as they demand us). Problems with filth, bad service... Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget experience”
Reviews.Author: Love_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here whilst on business. Excellent location, excellent facilities, helpful staff, good breakfast, and an absolute bargain. Very clean. I would not hesitate to stay here again. It is right above Earls Court tube station, so I'm guessing some rooms might be a little noisy, especially in the basement. I was on the ground floor and had no problems at all. The location is great, 2mins from Earls Court station and all of the surrounding shops/eateries. It's a nice area to walk around on an evening, and only 10-15 mins walk from Kensington.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Earls Court . . .”
Reviews.Author: Iwasthere07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were organising an event at Earls Court - It's in an excellent location and takes about 5 minutes to walk there. The staff were very courteous throughout our stay. The room (Room 1) and bathroom was a good size and very clean. The breakfast was good, and you can pay a little extra for hot food. All in all a perfectly good hotel for business travel. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Small dusty pokey room with bad television”
Reviews.Author: Squashed
Reviews.Content: Bad points The hotel insisted on full pay before I had even seen the room Room cramped and dusty. Promotional photos very deceiving We received a phone call at 11.00 on the last day telling us checkout was 11.00 and a threat to charge us 10.00 pound for any additional time. This was the first mention of the 11.00 checkout. Good points Great location close to all amenities Clean towels everyday

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: naybcfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the 1st weekend in October as we were exhibiting at Earls Court. The location from there was perfect as its only a 2 minute walk and accessible to the tube station. The outside of the hotel and reception desk were neat and tidy, however we were a little disappointed with the size of rooms VERY SMALL!- we were staying there 3 nights, for a 1 night stay it would have been sufficient. Breakfast was ok. The only disappointing elements were the poor customer service on arrival and departure and the fact that when we left our luggage to be looked after, I was very upset to find my suitcase had been left in the basement breakfast room, which was accesible to other guests, and not locked away. I would not recommend this hotel to others as I believe Customer Service is the most important part of any stay in a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: marion b
Reviews.Content: Staff were very courtous room although very small was clean and comfortable,but the shower had very little water pressure.Very convienent location if you want to stay in central London,I would not stay there again Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Don't even think of staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: ibpo
Reviews.Content: Any promotional images of this so called hotel are completely misleading. Yes 'the rooms' do have the styling as suggested in the photo's, BUT, are the rooms rooms or small partitioned- off spaces in a building? By the time the 'over styled' 'rooms' have their furnishings in, there is barely any room to move, resulting in having to almost squeeze yourself around the bed, then squeeze yourself into the the shower-'room' (or, more aptly, 'shower-cupboard') that somehow defies physics and just about has a toilet and basin in and enough space to just about let you stand. Back in the 'bed-space', try letting daylight in with the 'broken in a pulled down position blinds' and you'll fail. This ridiculous experience is compounded by either taking the smallest lift in the world - choose between your luggage or yourself to use it in turn - or going up the stairs and through the strangest 'corridors' in the world; a labyrinth so narrow you have to almost call ahead to check no-one else is coming, as there certainly isn't any passing space, whilst at the same time very carefully studying the floor for the unexpected humps and changes of levels perhaps deliberately boobie-trapped under the world's most hideous carpet. Again you wonder if these are real corridors or partitioned off spaces in a building desperately trying - and evening more desperately failing - to maximise space to gain 'rooms' / (or perhaps cells is a better description)! You certainly have to allow yourself additional time to navigate your way through the corridors because they are indeed a tiresome puzzle with no windows in and what seems like endless turns: - if you do tragically find yourself in this nightmare, perhaps use a pen or lipstick to mark your route, don't worry about spoiling the decor, that would be impossible because the walls don't have any and it would be impossible to make the carpet visually any worse. OK, so that's the non-organic part of this rubbish hotel, now for customer service - there isn't any! Like the narrowness and nastiness of the corridors, so too were the staff during my unfortunate stay (especially the 'manager') when it came to using their minds and mouths!! Perhaps parts of their brains had also been partitioned! - KEEP AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: uxonion
Reviews.Content: With hopes sky high I was shown to a basement room with the double bed against the wall making it difficult for two people. I asked for a higher floor and was refused. The breakfast is taken inthe basement. Very poky room. Sliced bread to toast or croissants. Fresh fruit salad OK but at best this is a very average guest house/hotel I prefer the Best Western hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: Sheena M
Reviews.Content: When searching for a hotel in London we came across the Mayflower, the photo's on their website looked really nice and although we did not expect the luxurious room on the photo we certainly didn't think we would end up in the prison like room we were given. We had booked late so assumed that we had been given the last and smallest room but were then told by the cleaner that all of the rooms (except for the nice one on the photos) were the same. The room was barely big enough to unpack our suitcase. The bed was against the wall so I had to climb over my partner to get out. The lift was extremely outdated (and I'm not sure it was even legal!) It barely fit two people in it and took forever to even go up 1 floor. We were assured by the staff that no-one had ever been stuck in the lift but on speaking to other guests (who were equally unhappy) found that 3 of them had been stuck in the lift on seperate occassions over that weekend. Breakfast (well thats what they called it) consisted of a plate of cheese and meat that looked like it had been left out for days, some cereal, warm yoghurt, bread and coffee that made you feel like you were about to have a heart attack. There was a hot breakfast menu on the table (which you had to pay extra for) but at no point did anyone ask if we wanted to order anything. We also noticed a 'roof terrace'. This was an area on the roof (5 floors up) with barely a scaffolding pole to stop anyone falling off. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy and am surprised that they are even allowed to trade!

Reviews.Title: “Saved”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: After serious problems with standards of another hotel around the corner we were so thankful to The Mayflower Hotel. The room was great, as was breakfast, but it was the courteous attitude of staff we shall remember most. As I was travelling alone with my daughter it meant a lot to return after a long day to a safe friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “convenience”
Reviews.Author: SfCoconuts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mayflower three times. The first two rooms were quiet. The room I had this year was oppsite the Earls Court Tube station and was noisey. The bed creaked. The breakfast is substantial and the bathrooms are wonderful. The hotel is clean and convenient to transportation. The staff is professional. They have added a computer for guest use in the lounge for a modest fee. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mj2624
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. the rooms are really small yet packed with heavy furniture and nick knacks. to actually use the bed we had to put the 6 massive display cusions, suede over throw, our suit cases, laptop and coats in the shower. the 'desk' is a piece of wood 15cm wide which is attached to the wall, you might be able to use it to work if it didn't have the tea making stuff, the phone, a large lamp, a phone directory, a glass bowl and 8 lifestyle magazines in it. the springs are all coming through the mattress and there is no real base. the mattress is just on a high wooden base which makes it very difficult to get out of. the double bed is also against one wall so your partner has to climb over you to get out. the breakfast is poor, just cerial, croisants and slices of cheese, tomatoes and cheap ham which don't change from day to day. my husband actually tucked a butter portion under a slice of ham and it was still there when we left for days later. the coffee, tea and milk are on a shelf above your head. i actually broke the milk jug as i was having to get hold of it by the smooth bottom bit as i couldn't reach the handle. the tv only work intermitently. when we checked in we were told to turn the safe off on the wall and that will reset the code to 0000 as most guests forget the number they have set it to. we decided not to use after verifying that that was the default code for ever safe in the hotel. the absolute worst part of this hotel is the security. when we arrived it was 10pm and dark. the windows in our hotel were open and we went to bed. we over slept and went straight down to breakfast when we woke up. once backin our room we were getting ready for the day when a man knocked on the outside of our window to ask for a light. the balcony outside our window runs along the length of the hotel with no breaks between the rooms. each night of our stay there were people outside on the balcony, smoking a talking. they weren't being rowdy so reception wouldn't do anything. on the saturday night there were about 15 people out there at 3am who were obviously drunk. the balcony is about a foot wide and only about a foot from the end of our bed. we booked the hotel to do a trade show so we needed our sleep which we didn't get.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back, and will advise all friends and family not to go there”
Reviews.Author: sara503867
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel! They charged me an extra Â£40 from my account without authorisation and when I rang the receptionist to confirm this, she was extremely rude and vague about what it was for. Will never stay there ever again

Reviews.Title: “To run a hotel or not to run a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtreat
Reviews.Content: Locotion of the hotel is around the corner from Earl's Court St. which is good and bad as there is a lot of noise from the tube in the back and traffic at the front of the hotel. Breakfast (cold dishes) is reasonable and ample and on a good day one can eat in the back garden. Above two points are the only "positives" about this hotel, the rest is much to be desired or better stated horrible. Untrained and unfriendly reception staff, stamp size rooms ( could barely use the toilet), mini mostly non working tv with complicated instructions, skimping on towel quality and toiletries, no instructions for the safe, etc etc etc, too much to name. The website is deceiving and does not represent the hotel. My first move would be to fire the night reception staff on the spot. Stay at your own risk, I will NEVER again!

Reviews.Title: “Get the bigger room”
Reviews.Author: BNash
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the metro and good restaurants. Rooms are very small (even for Europe) get the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “poor standard - there are better for the price”
Reviews.Author: ducatijane
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights. Rooms are very small an bear no resemblance to the ones shown on the internet and on the display board outside the hotel. The rooms are so small that the double bed is against a wall down one side so if occupied by two people, one would have to climb over the other to get out! Very dark rooms. Had to get someone up from reception to fix TV that wouldn't work. Shower ran freezing cold one day (and not very powerful), so had to have a strip wash prior to being on a trade stand all day.Yuk! No air con and rooms at the back are next to Earls Court tube station so too noisy to have windows open on warm night. Breakfast is continental only and you will pay extra for cooked. Not enough staff on duty so we were waiting a while to be seated (as instructed)Tables took a while to be cleaned and cleared. Cost Â£110 per night and I'm sure there will be better for similar price.Car park is 4 cars only and is more than the 3 mins walk away...,and you have to have someone go with you as it is kept locked. Room had a 'slept in' smell to it, although everything was clean and tidy. There was a thumping noise that occured all night, each night and no idea where it was coming from. Managed to get to sleep through it but it was annoying. Staff were helpful and friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful which room you book”
Reviews.Author: StRev
Reviews.Content: I was booked into a "double room". I have two cupboards back at home that were bigger than that room. The double bed was at one side and a minimum of space at the other. I do not think the space would be legal for a prison cell under the Human Rights Act. The first night the mattress was terible with springs/wires sticking in my back, although after complaining they did change it. Despite my room issue the staff seemed ok and some of my colleagues rooms were apparely quite spacious. Just be careful which room you are booking.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all boxes”
Reviews.Author: hogan_stiniog
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at this hotel. Staff at reception were pleasant. I had booked a single room, size was ok for one person and the double bed was very comfortable. I happened to be there during a heatwave, there was a large ceiling fan in the room which quickly cooled the room down.The hotel is very near the tube station but I wasn't disturbed during sleeping hours. Continental breakfast was good. Everywhere was clean. I was there to attend a concert at Shepherds Bush and as a lone female felt safe when returning late at night. Plenty of food places within 1 minute walk from hotel and tube station about 3 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “We felt welcome, safe, and comfortable here.”
Reviews.Author: matt1776
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were lucky to find this place to make a last minute reservation after arriving in London and finding the original hotel completely unacceptable. The Mayflower happened to have only one room available due to a recent cancellation and it happened to be a very nice hotel. They were kind and professional and even though the room was much more expensive they gave it to us at the standard double room rate. The entire place was clean and in good condition, the breakfast was typical for European fare, but was quality and constantly replenished by the staff while having a short menu to order from in addition to the buffet. We felt welcome, safe, and comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “What a deception - We won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: JnT45
Reviews.Content: Do not trust the lovely photos on their web site!!!! Very misleading! Rooms were supposed to be "individually designed and all decorated with original artefacts and woodcarved furniture". Simply NOT true! Our bedroom was on the top/fourth floor, through narrow claustrofobic hallways, dark corners, behind a dusty cloud of renovation works (No 43). The room was literally the tiniest I have ever seen. We travel a lot all over the world and adjust to practically anything and don't request much to be happy. But this was an insult, especially as the price doesn't correspond the standards! The double bed was against the wall leaving no space around it. You could not pass eachother to get to toilet, without one having to get onto the bed to let the other pass. There was nowhere to put down your watch/phone/eyeglasses by the bed, obviously as no space for such thing as bedside table. Luckily we only had one small soft overnightbag, as you could not have fitted a suitcase inside the room. (Nor in the lift, as it's so small that only two people without luggage can just fit in). "The original artefacts and wooden furniture in each room" must have been the tiny wooden box on toilet shelf containing soap? Also, that shelf was propped on the wall above the sink so that you could not get your head above it to wash without squahing your forehead on the taps! We had to go through a dense cloud of dust to find our room. We first thought it was smoke, as there were noise and repair works going on. The hotel was not nearly full, so we asked whether we could use another room as they hadn't finished renovation works on that floor and as my husband gets breathing problems with so much dust. Two staff (older indian woman and a younger man) followed me to our floor and I showed the dense dust that was very visible, especially in the beam of ceiling light. The woman refused to see the problem and insisted that the "dust was not actually dust, it is just the light"! (Actually you could hardly see the light from the dust). They did not want to make their clients welcome and enjoy their stay. We then had to keep the window open to get some air. Luckily it was quite warm outside, however, the subway station is practically just below the window so it was quite noisy. They obviously try greedily squeeze too many rooms in the old quirky building, charging absolutely too much for what you get. We will definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential but falls short”
Reviews.Author: maydaymom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several things going for it: a great location on a quiet street right next to the underground and lots of shops and restaurants. Also, nice curb appeal and lobby, and a courteous staff. But that's about it. Our room was reached by several flights of dark narrow stairs or a tiny elevator, followed by a dizzying walk through a claustrophobic maze of hallways, many under construction and downright treacherous. The room itself was just big enough for the double bed and a miniature desk and stool that would never be of functional use. The only thing to do while in the room was to lie on a very, very hard bed and try to watch a tv that only got four channels with horrible reception. The bathroom by contrast was fairly spacious and updated. Cleanliness wasn't an issue. But walls were thin and hallway traffic was very loud. It seems like management is trying to squeeze way too many rooms into this property, and with cheap construction. Shame, because there's lots of potential here.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: buzzer71
Reviews.Content: This hotel staff are terrible. I arrived at 11pm having booked a room, they knew I would be arriving at this time. I was told there was no room for me. They transferred me to another hotel for one night, I was then returned to them for the second night. The sister hotel did not know that I was arriving, the taxi driver that took me to the sister hotel did not know where I was going. The staff just did not care, it was a nightmare.....

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room I EVER had! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: alfredmilano
Reviews.Content: I travel twice a month allover the world and my company arranged 2 nights at the mayflower as the homepage looked great. BUT the rooms are so incredibly small, 2 people can not enter with luggage !!! probably if 2 people travel with only 1 piece of lugagge it might be ok, but forget it if you travel with 2 pieces!!! even the Ibis rooms seem double the size! I can not believe that somebody pays such a lot of money for something like this... don't get fooled by the homepage!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shame about the service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not complaint here, because overall it was a pleasant stay for the night, but the TV wasn't working and there are one or two bite marks on me that I know weren't there before! The rooms appeared to be clean, but the bed-bigs don't lie. Breakfast was lovely and the staff were friendly but the TV is essential when you have no money left for any of the bounty London has on offer and we couldn't get a scrap out of it. Other than those two things, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Kurt K
Reviews.Content: Exellent location close to Earls Court,in a quiet street. But TV did not work properly,and the shower was too hot,was not able to use.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Katiebug165
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, booked standard double room, not very big but very clean and bathroom lovely too. The staff are really helpful, printed out map of an address I was looking for. Continental breakfast was very nice. Only thing I did'nt like was that we could hear people walking around upstairs and walls seemed pretty thin too. The location seemed very safe and there were some lovely restaurants near by, also the tube is only few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for exploring London!”
Reviews.Author: holiday_queenWexford
Reviews.Content: We found the Mayflower online and it was one of the best value places on offer. The hotel has great curb appeal as does the reception and the staff were nice on the desk. Inside the hotel was a little different. The lift was pretty tight as were the hallways and the room was no different. Although it was nicely decorated and clean, it was small and we were lucky we only had small luggage!! Also our particular room was on the side of the Earls Court underground and we heard it from early every morning!As the weather was amazing when we were there we had to leave the window open which didnt help the noise from the train station! Breakfast was fine and we had a decent meal before heading out for the day!The area the hotel is in is nice and we found some nice restaurants close by! Overall the hotel was nice, good location & clean!Just a bit on the small side so dont big too much luggage with you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ollie09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayflower hotel in Ears Court for 4 nights this months. Its a very nice hotel, clean, nice staff. The continental breakfast was nice. Ok, the room was very small but when in London you don`t spend your time at the hotel! Its very good located, close to everything. We had our room facing the underground station, but with the window closed we didnt here it, and you are in a big city so there`s bound to be some noice.

Reviews.Title: “Photos on the website are very deceiving”
Reviews.Author: nightrider9383
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the lady gave us the key to a ground floor room, when we were opening the door, the person from the room next door said 'Try and get another room, these are horrible and loud'. When we opened to the door we found it had 2 beds, (between single and double size, with not enough room for two people. When I approached reception I advised that we were a couple and we had ordered a double room with one bed. SHe responded and said " I thought you would like the room because its a big family room" When i tried to explain again that we were a couple and not a family she said she would show me the double room and I could swap if I wanted to. She took me up to the room where there was barely room to move or put suitcases etc (the photos on the web are not realistic). We ended up staying in the groundfloor room which turned out to be worse because it was next to the door and stairs that went down to the breakfast room. Everytime someone opened the door our door would make a loud banging nose (due to a wind pocket) as though someone was trying to break in. A family room although bigger than the double room couldnt even fit two suitcases let alone enough for a family. The room was stuffy and hot and there was no relief from the ceiling fan. I would not stay here again. - The bathroom was so small that when you had a shower the toilet would get wet and the towel racks were above the toilet so you had to hang them over the door

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, trendy hotel, excellent location and fair price.”
Reviews.Author: kenr55461
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a trendy lobby and knowledgable staff. The room was upgraded from a double to 2 double beds and ensuite bath. The beds were firm mattress on platform, no box springs. Sheets clean. Bath is large with walk-in shower, lavatory, and wc. Trendy fixtures. TV and wi-fi. Breakfast is continental, but you could add on for hot breakfast. Our room overlooked the subway but with double insulated windows and soundproof curtains, we could not hear it.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS GOOD AS ITS SISTER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MairGravatt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 20 Nevern Square, the sister hotel to the Mayflower, a couple of times and had high expectations. The staff at the Mayflower were fine and we were upgraded to a suite. Whilst the room was of a good size and had a kitchen which we did not need I need to point out a couple of negative points - the room backed onto the tube line and was noisy and the sheets on the bed were "scratchy". The towels had seen better days - they were hard and there was a distinct smell of drains in the room. Breakfast was adequate. In future I would revert to the more superior sister hotel at 20 Nevern Square.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ThomasCT
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the sister property twenty nevern around the corner and decided to give this hotel a try. outrageous price for the room!! i was located on the fourth floor during a hot summer stay. the room was so hot i could not sleep....there are fans which are noisy and ineffective. the room was so small i could not even turn around. my closets at home are larger. there was a chair in the room the wobbled and almost falling apart. the TV did not work at first. there was a very small window. if i was paying an appropriate rate i would have expected this type of hostel room. the lobby and breakfast rooms are nice. breakfast is simple and acceptable. not like the sister property however. i was hoping to be able to write a much better review of this property. unfortunately i will not stay at this property again. the staff was friendly and pleasant and i was hoping for a different outcome.

Reviews.Title: “Moved here from the Twenty Nevern due to 'water' issues - no way near as good!”
Reviews.Author: NumbersONEandTWO
Reviews.Content: I was moved (with no complaints at all) to the Mayflower from its sister hotel, Twenty Nevern Square, due to issues with water pressure. Check-in was smooth and I was shown to my room. I can't quite put my finger on it, but the room was just lacking something - the rooms at the Nevern are much nicer and just better designed. The room was tiny and the bathroom not great. I would certainly not look to stay here again, even though the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a good price. recommended”
Reviews.Author: fizzy62
Reviews.Content: After much trawling through the reviews on London hotels, we had resigned ourselves to a less than good experience in any London hotel. We were pleasantly surprised at how comfortable our executive room was. we had room 6 near to reception. so we were a bit worried about noise. but it was very quiet. It was beautifully furnished and very clean. there was generous supply of tea and coffee and a selection of magazines. Nice touch! We loved the Indian furniture so it felt very much like home complete with a working ceiling fan which was a godsend because the room was very warm. Bathroom was clean and there was a generous quantity of clean towels. The continental breakfast was really good. The only gripe? minor things. the bathroom was very small so if you're a 'big' person, then its not for you, and the tv was pretty rubbish. but would we stay there again. yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: nepb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower Hotel and Apartments for one night on the 26 February 2010. The Hotel was been renovated and is beautifully decorated and styled. Our room was super, super tiny but very modern. The bed was squashed against one wall and there was barely enough room to walk around the other side of the bed, or the end of the bed. The bathroom was also quite small, but clean and modern. We didnâ€™t mind that is was so small as we were out all day and only used it as a place to sleep, so it was perfect for that. You kind of have to expect that when you are in London, all apartments are very small unless you are willing to pay big bucks for luxury and space. Very modern, very clean would definitely stay here again. Things to know Internet: Free wireless internet Tube Station: The hotel is 50m away from the tube station so it is very convenient when you can just walk down the road and jump on the tube. Room Size: The hotel has larger rooms for families etcâ€¦ but because there was only two of us we stayed in the small room. - Breakfast: Bread, cereal, cold meats, cheese, juice, tea/coffee

Reviews.Title: “Bad Policy”
Reviews.Author: ZenoCrockett
Reviews.Content: I was stranded outside of London because of the volcanic eruptions but I knew my flight was canceled more than 24 hours in advance. I called the hotel and informed them that I couldn't make it and they assured me my card would not be charged. Of course, they billed me. I then called and spoke with the manager who told me it was their policy to bill every card they receive no matter how far in advance the cancellation. In addition he told me it was the policy of the hotel to advise clients to "Dispute it with Visa". I think this a disgusting policy in the wake of a natural disaster. Stay away from these scam artists.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NO business oriented hotel !”
Reviews.Author: malka_perlichka
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is wonderful. But this is the only thing that's worth about it. I could not get to London at all due to the natural disaster that happened. After a bunch of phone calls I've made, a fax with the cancelation of my reservation has been sent to them by the web site where my reservation was done online. BUT cancelling a reservation that is due to a NATURAL DISASTER is not in the hotel policy rules. Can you imagine that ??? I've been charged to the full amount of my stay there, even without an excuse. So, if you want to be treated like me, without any respect as a client. you are welcome to go there !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: espeso
Reviews.Content: We got a room in the top floor (42). The room was basically as big as a big suitcase. It fitted the bed and a desk. It was quite dirty, long hairs in the bed and bath room. The bed was so hard and so was the pillows. My girlfirend looked at me in the morning and said "this is the worst hotel ever"... Besides the absolutely horrible bed and pillows, the subway was right next to the hotel, and with no air-con we had to have the wondow open. The tube ended at 0030 and started up 0530... Not that we got to exploit the hours in between. When the coupoe next door opened their door it sounded like people were walking into our room. The rooms waere just cramped together. The pillows were so darn hard.. like solid bricks.. can't tell you how much pain I had in he neck and the back after staying there... So to sum up the experience. Even if we only paid Â£69 per night - No sleep at all! and yes probably my worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: lerrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last night with my partner and it was very pleasant. Our room was quite small but nicely furnished and clean. The bathroom really surprised me as it was really clean and designed really well. We were on Level 3 - the rickety lift did scare me slightly but it seemed to work fine. Polite staff and did not have any problems. Saw two rats outside though but this would be expected in London.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but satisfying”
Reviews.Author: Hannecd
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on this website, we decided to upgrade as we arrived at the hotel. The upgrading from standard double en-suite to executive double en-suite cost us Â£15 a night, and it was well worth the money. We were explained that the standard rooms were very small, with room little more than the bed. When upgrading we got a small, but rather nicely furnished bedroom, with a high double bed (with wooden carvings India style), with room underneath to stack the suitcases. There was a TV, a big Indian wardrobe, and a desk. Big windows facing Trebovir Road. The bathroom was small, but nice with tiled walls and nice equipment, and clean (!). The first morning the breakfast room was full, so we decided to have breakfast in a local cafe instead, but the next two mornings we ate at the hotel. Breakfast was good and plenty: rolls, bread for toasts, croissants, muesli, fruit, cheese, coffee, tea, juice, milk...... Service was also good. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we left our luggage in the foyer, and on return, the luggage hade been placed in our room. The next morning we discovered that the electric kettle was not clean (probably some earlier guests have been warming milk or something in it) and when we pointed that out, the kettle was changed immediately. Some of the other reviewers complain about the room size. I quite agree, everything in this hotel is very tiny. The web side photos are almost real size photos! Tine reception, tiny rooms, narrow staircases, but if you're not planning to spend much time at the hotel, it serves your needs. The location is very convenient: 1 min from Earls Court underground station. .

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: st1987
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard double room at this hotel for one night with my partner. After booking the room, I came across this website and the reviews that it had received! Instantly I was concerned and was apprehensive about going. However I really shouldnâ€™t have been. The hotel is in a brilliant location, mere minutes from Earls Court tube station and very easy to find. It is situated in a pleasant street; (with plenty of shops, restaurants and cash points all nearby.) We checked in with ease and received a warm welcome. The inside of the hotel is clean, tidy and well decorated. When we got into the room we were pleasantly surprised after reading other peopleâ€™s thoughts - yes it was smaller than other rooms that you may have stayed in before - but again, it was decorated nicely, very clean, had a television and free view box, tea and coffee making facilities and a nice clean bathroom. For just under Â£80 in a prime location, I donâ€™t think you could ask for anything better! A continental breakfast was included in the price, which is served at a reasonable time and in a designated â€˜breakfast room.â€™ The food that was provided when we stayed was nice and there was plenty of juice and tea and coffee on offer. (The only negative thing about it, was that it is a small room and there is the feeling that you are sitting very closely to other guests.) I do agree that if you had a big suitcase with you, that it would be a slight problem because there is not much extra space in the room. Also I do agree that their website is not entirely accurate to the reality - particularly if you are staying in one of the standard rooms. However, if you are staying for a short amount of time, it is a perfect base and has all the facilities that you need. Finally, the price is key to what you are getting. In a prime London location to pay under Â£100 and expect a large room with lots of added luxuries is naÃ¯ve - as long as you take that into consideration - I donâ€™t think it deserves the criticism that it has received.

Reviews.Title: “Enter At Your Own Risk If You Want To Be Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: shazneyEngland
Reviews.Content: Well where shall I start, the web photos are nothing like what you are going to get. My friend and I booked a twin room and what we got was a shoe box with noise from the trains and a view of a Corination Street back yard, six inches space between the beds, a very small TV on top of the wardrobe, stained toilet, broken grate in the shower and the tea cups were dirty.So we decided to complain (what a waste of time that was) very unhelpful, the housekeeper said the toilet was stained due to the toilet brush going backwards and forwards as she cleaned it (could not bring myself to look at the toilet brush) The broken shower grate was done by another guest so it was not their fault (at this point the housekeeper was showing my friend and I how the other guest broke the grate by standing in the shower with her shoes on pretending to have a shower. We decided to go and find another hotel as this was not what we expected to find having booked from the web site picturing lovely rooms on it, how wrong can you be, we got the broom cupboard turned twin bedroom. We asked for a refund so that we could go and find a decent hotel but the hotel operates a 48hour cancellation policy also taking full payment before checking in. We now know why that is, this hotel makes a living from taking peoples money and not returing it when there is a genuine complaint, this is easy money for them. We left and spent a brilliant night at the Premier Inn Kensington just round the corner ( I would fully recommend this hotel for a really great stay) We were offered by the Mayflower an upgrade for Â£20 for the Saturday night , we took this offer as the Premier was full but what a mistake to think this would be any better, the room was slightly bigger but the bathroom was smaller than the previous room with very little room to even sit on the toilet properly, this was the last straw and we have cut our trip to London short and come home. The staff at the Mayflower were very unhelpful and was not concerned we were leaving as they say they have never had any complaints before, I beg to differ maybe they should read their review. This hotel is no more than a "DHSS Bed and Breakfast"and to top it all my friends husband rang them up to complain only to have the phone hung up on him.that says it all about this place. dee and shaz

Reviews.Title: “MAYFLOWER IS HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: seraphita
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the pictures. This was the worst hotel ever stayed at.. Bed springs stick out of bed and could not walk right all day. Next to train station and loud. Managment has NO concern for guest care and would not let us leave early!. Do not check in until you have seen the room!. Check for the heat in room if you can adjust. Check if toilet was clean (ours was not!!) horrible smell in room!! Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing throughout! Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_or_nowt
Reviews.Content: I was deceived into booking into the Mayflower Hotel by an outrageously flattering website and recommendation from CondÃ© Nast. What appeared to be an excellent rate for a spacious, well equipped room was in fact a poor deal on the smallest hotel room I've ever set eyes on. The apparently slightly-below-standard-sized double bed reached from the partition separating the sink (in the bedroom, not the bathroom) to the far end of the room, with a very narrow channel separating the only accessible side of the bed from the poorly built, shallow, inadequate wardrobe. The shoe-box feel of the room was compounded by the angled wall at the foot of the bed. Dissatisfied with the room, we were, reluctantly offered another which was marginally bigger - the bed was in this room was only against one wall(!) The usable size of the room (including the bed which felt smaller than a standard double) was roughly 7' square - smaller than some hotel bathrooms! Again, the quality of the furniture was very poor, the blind was torn and frayed along the length of one side. The bathroom was basic, and not well cleaned which may have contributed to the slight unpleasant smell. The noise from the road is almost unbearable, but is marginally more palatable than the shrieking caged birds in the 'juice bar'. Breakfast is included, but isn't a saving grace for this terrible hotel. A small selection of unidentified cereals, foul tea and coffee, and artificial-tasting unidentifed juice was topped only by the croissants which gave the impression they were baked a week previously. I didn't pluck up the courage to try the plates of two very-cheap looking processed meats or dry cheese. Cereal with milk had been spilled on the floor of the breakfast room before we reached it, and was still unattended when we had finished. The staff are less than enthusiastic, an appropriate reflection of the hotel. The hotel's website is entirely misleading, using words such as "spacious comfort", "luxury", "state-of-the-art" and "elegant" to describe what would be a step down from the average student halls of residence.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided”
Reviews.Author: wayfarerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A six night stay with payment in advance meant we had to stick with this very average hotel. The standard room pre booked was so small that we could not fit our luggage and the two of us in the same room so a upgrade to the 'Luxury room' was negotiated with difficulty. Cleanliness of the room and houskeeeping standards were poor. Hotel staff were mostly courteous but little enthusiasm was displayed. Take several references in some well known travel guides with a grain of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Newton3
Reviews.Content: We had a bereavement , the Hotel took all the money for the cancelled room and then booked the room again, taking double money , and leaving a very distressed grieving wife. Their management supported this process.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - check the location of your apartment is not on a major road with a noise level to wake the dead.”
Reviews.Author: SAOztwo
Reviews.Content: Booked a one bedroom apt. in good faith having stayed with this hotel on Trebovir Road before. On arrival, taken some distance to "newly refurbished' property with an extremely busy 3 lane road literally metres from the bedroom window. The website has flash pictures of both bathroom and kitchen, however the substance is not there with very poor/dirty/minimal cooking equipment , a significant drainage problem in the shower, and a certainly not new, rock hard bed. Upon expressing our dismay at our location, the staff replied we should have filled out a special request at the time of booking and no, they did not have any other vacancy to relocate us. A done on the cheap renovaton of an older building in a poor location. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: AliAli82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Apartment 10 in the apartments on Warwick road. At our late arrival we were shown our apartment by a polite young man. The lobby was lovely and the receptionist informed us that there was a buffet breakfast every day until 9:30. After several steep flights of stairs we arrived. The flights of stairs did not bother us but I can imagine how they could be bad for young children or the elderly. Our apartment was exactly what we needed. It had a fully furnished kitchen, double bed and eating area. Though we went out to eat for most meals, we stayed in a couple times and cooked during our five night stay. The maid service was great. The young women were very friendly and cautious not to disturb. Our only complaints are the following: -no air conditioner (though there is a fan which made the room bareable during the day) -only 1 channel on the tv worked. After midnight there was absolutely nothing to watch. -during breakfast most of the staff are very friendly, unfortunately one guy who worked there made it difficult to enjoy a relaxing breakfast. The first time we walked in he looked at his watch before he said hello, worried we got there after the 9:30 deadline (10:00 on weekends). He pretty much yells at you to get out, warning 5 more minutes to everyone and taking away the food before 9:30! We enjoyed our breakfast only once when it was his day off... This man needs to take his job a little less seriously and put his customers first. Otherwise, we were quite pleased with our stay. Do not expect 5* because it is not a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: incrocodible
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Mayflower hotel for a week this August with my boyfriend and we absolutely loved it. Mayflower hotel has a good location on a quiet Trebovir Road with excellent connections (underground). We are budget travellers not interested in luxury accommodation, but Mayflower felt like it to us, for 70 pounds per night! The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room (n:o 40) was tidy and comfortable with beautiful textiles and nice wooden floor. The bathroom was clean and shiny with a very good shower. We had coffee making facilities, a safety deposit box, hair dryer, a free WiFi and a fan, which is more than we usually expect. Breakfast buffet was served in pleasant breakfast room with access to outside terrace. Buffet included coffee/tea, juice, croissants and bread rolls with jam and other toppings, youghurts with muesli etc. and fresh fruit. When in London, you have to accept things like narrow corridors with floor to floor carpeting or tiny lifts. Houses are small and hotels are no exception, at least not in our price range. We will definitely stay in Mayflower hotel next time we are visiting London! We just hope they are not discovered by too many travellers and tempted to rise their prices...

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS IN APARTMENT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: divera67
Reviews.Content: apartment not attached to hotel-ten minute walk round corner-couldd cope with this (plus the noise and general decay) BUT then discovered about ten bedbugs on both bed and sofa bed when we came back at midnight!!!! hotel had no room to accommodate us by then (did not want to risk another apartment) so we had to ring around other places. Having paid laterooms.com Â£300 for a 2 nite stay this was shocking. The young guy on reception was very apologetic and offered us use of the internet to find somewhere else but really, this is not on. we had to carry our bags back round through the streets to get refund and then start ringing hotels in the area. eventually found acommodation at 1 am. Nightmare. bed bugs aside, the apartment was not the cleanest, dingy, very very noisy and not very secure-e.g. balcony doors did not lock. (right beside tube station, main road) Could have suffered these but the bugs ....no. they suggested that the previous guests may have brought them in...????really not good enough and i won't be booking through laterooms again either!

Reviews.Title: “We will repeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: merlinefr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for 4 nights at the Mayflower Hotel. Located on a quiet, charming, residential street, a short distance from Earl's Court tube, and many good restaurants, the Mayflower is an excellent hotel in London. The accommodation is modern elegance and well maintained, with good sized, modern bathrooms. Breakfast was very good, with a nice selection of continental, and English. Above all, the staff at the Mayflower were friendly, accommodating and always willing to help. Truly an enjoyable stay. We would recommend to anyone going to London. We will be back for sure next time we're in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Courtesy, and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Barce888
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours had recommended the Mayflower Hotel to us, some time ago, so we had high expectations. Fortunately we were not disappointed. The hotel is very close to Earl's Court station, and therefore it is very easy traveling to Heathrow airport, or 15 minutes from London's West End. The hotel looks great inside, with some lovely architectural details, and the use of some beautiful fabrics make for a wonderful atmosphere. Our room was comfortable, and clean, and the staff were friendly, and helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel, and are looking forward to a return visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Timapu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once and I was pleasantly surprised. I recieved a newly renovated room on the lower level and it was modern, clean and quiet. The one thing i remember about the staff was that I had gone on this trip post a divorce and i was a little down when i arrived. When i was shown to my room there was a desk girl that came to my room to ask me if i needed anything or if i wanted to talk for a minute. She seemed genuinely interested in helping me. That was honestly very sweet and unexpected. My stay was for a week and it was so close to the earls court tube station and in walking distance from nice pubs and things to do. Very nice charming neighbourhood and felt safe. I really liked my room and my bed was soft and the bathroom was really great! It had a walk in open stone or slate shower, bowl and swan neck sink and very clean. This was a pleasant surprise and I was very glad I chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 2 nights in a WONDERFUL hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahlegs
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Mayflower a little apprehenisve after reading some recent reviews. I walked left out Earls Court tube station, left again, and 1 minute down the road and i was at the Mayflower, so first star for location- SO central and easy to get to. I arrived at the lovely reception area and was greeted by a friendly helpful receptionist, second star. He asked to take payment for the room, but as i wanted to see the room first he allowed me to just swipe my credit card and pay after i had checked out the room, third star. As he then led me outside the hotel and down some stairs to a basement room he told me we had been upgraded to a luxury suite,fourth star. WOW. HUGE four poster bed, beautiful furniture and bedding, kitchen, dining table, huge TV, walk in closet and massive bathroom which giant shower. I was a very happy girl, fifth star. Everything was clean and high standard, only problem was the remote died, but we werent really interested in watching TV anyway. Could have done with more towels, and be careful of the shower... it floods easily as there is no door, its more of a wetroom. All in all i had a fantastic 5star 2 day getaway to London and the fact we only paid for a standard double room made it even better. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “average - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: pompompol
Reviews.Content: On arrival hotel looked lovely, reception & lounge very modern. Lift very small! we stayed in room 34, which was very "compact", no air conditioning so had to open windows but then had to close them as very noisy - trains!!!!. bathroom lovely. When going to breakfast found breakfast room very nice again modern, then I asked for traditional breakfast as did not want continental, i chose scrambled egg, mushroom, tomatoes, sausage and toast price - Â£7.50!!!!!! only to be told they only do halal sausage - please forgive me but this was London and would at least have liked a choice ie: british sausage, vegetarian sausage or halal!!!!in the end i chose scrambled egg, mushroom & toast - Â£3.99 If we did stay again i would skip breakfast and pop to McDonalds round the corner - would be cheaper!!!! On the whole hotel was clean just a few things could be changed - air con would make it more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but it's London, go out”
Reviews.Author: danielglak
Reviews.Content: In Earl's Court, the main travelers' district, so don't expect to meet many Londoners. But a nice place, friendly and cooperative. Very clean. The room is unbelievably tiny with just two camp cot sized beds. No honeymoons here. Who would come to London on a honeymoon anyway? Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet for a mid-range London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dad_of_Daisy
Reviews.Content: I booked 7 twin rooms for two nights to accommodate half of a stag party over a weekend. As the ages of the attendees ranged from mid-thirtes to late forties, we were keen not to end up in a hotel resembling some of the scrofulous fleapits I have previously had the displeasure to have endured on business trips to London. First impressions were good; friendly enough staff, in a small but smart reception area. The rooms were all well-appointed, if a little on the compact side (even for London). As best man I asked for one of the better rooms (purely for the sake of the groom, of course), and was perfectly happy with it. There was a small safe, a decent TV and tea/coffee tray, and the decor was clean and modern. From the selection I saw, every room has individual styling, and there were no complaints from any of our party. The bathroom was a treat - quality fittings & fixtures and a big walk-in tiled shower with good pressure and an unwavering constant temperature. The beds were comfortable with fluffy duvets, and our 2nd-floor room didn't get too much street noise (not that I would have noticed, arriving back at 4.30am). There is 24-hour night porterage, and they are happy to hold on to your bags after you have checked out - although they didn't seem to be massively concerned about security, as we saw several bags sitting unattended in the small lounge adjoining the reception. Breakfast seemed to divide opinion. My friend's poached eggs looked tasty, although other reports suggested the standard was not consistent. Continental breakfast is included, anything cooked is a la carte. Personally, I would put the standard of the breakfast fairly low on my list of priorities when choosing a reasonably-priced London hotel - Earls Court Road is about 30 seconds' stroll away, so surely you can find something to eat? A dedicated curmudgeon could probably find something to moan about here, but for our purposes The Mayflower delivered just what we expected of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: sdebmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments and was pleasently surprised. The apartments are right next to the Earls Court tube station and opposite the Earls Court itself. The decor was modern, it was clean and the kitchenette was good. The only downside was that it was quite a walk from the main hotel - about 5-10 mins. So when you check in, you then have to walk to the apartment; don't wear heels like I did!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room - Unprofessional Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: SnorreNeggor
Reviews.Content: Don't go there or at least - Don't accept room no. 33! When we arrived at the hotel on Friday evening we were told we could profit from an upgrade to an "executive suite" for the same price. Strangely enough my girlfriend had to pay for our room (no. 33) in advance by credit card. We were soon to know why... On Saturday morning (7.30am) we both awoke from a disturbing and continuous loud humming noise which lasted about 15min - enough to be fully awake! When complaining to the reception staff they told us they would check what the problem was. They said it was the first time ever someone complained about this noise. On Sunday Morning we were again woken up at 04.45am by the same noise. From the regularity of the noise we finally guessed it must be a warm water pump which was installed directly above our bathroom. Every time some other hotel guest took a shower this noise made sleeping impossible. After complaining the reception staff gave us finally another room for our third night. However when we asked for an appropriate refund for not being able to sleep (one might think undisturbed sleep would be one main purpose of a hotel room) the staff showed absolutely no comprehension and told us only the hotel manager Faisaal Saloojee could decide on refunds, but he was back on Monday only (of course long after our scheduled departure)... Our written request for a refund was then denied with the following arguments (extracts) by Frank Davis, Customer Services: "Every room of the hotel has a water pump... unfortunately we have no control over the humming noise... Unfortunately, as your first complaint was about a noise in general we were trying to locate the source of the noise but to no avail... some guests might be light sleepers... Unfortunately, we are unable to honour your request for a refund as all refunds for a guest's stay must be made during guest's stay" (NICE ONE, huh?) "You have fully used the accomodation supplied without attempting to cancel your booking. Only on these occasions we would have been able to offer you a refund". No further comment...

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Marek17
Reviews.Content: On arrival was told they had no record of my confirmed booking, took ages to sort and I was due to go on a company Christmas party so was stressed. Room was tiny even for one night. Bathroom was not clean and there was too much noise at night as windows not double glazed. Arrived for breakfast at 8.30 next day and was told they had run out. Rude staff who would not help out. Hope this is not representative of London hotels, have travelled extensively and can say hotels in India and Eastern Europe at this grade were far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place”
Reviews.Author: byilmazsoy
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for 4 nights. They have me a room on the top floor. It was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen, smaller than an EastHotel room. It was impossible to put a bag anywhere. There was constantly noise from the railway. In November, the room was extremely hot even when the window was open. Instead of a duvet, there was a dirty blanket. The walls are paper thin. I had to cancel my booking after a sleepless night but had to pay for 2 extra nights due to the booking conditions. In the end I paid Â£10 more and stayed in a Hilton. Their single rooms are about 4 times bigger than what [--] hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Mayfloowe 10/10”
Reviews.Author: dyson_catherine
Reviews.Content: This is a really sweet well furnished 'bijoux' hotel, next door to earls court tube and easily accessible to lots of top attractions. The room was really nicely decorated, small but everything was a good standard (We did get a free upgrad from a standard to an executive room though) the lounge and breakfast room were really nice, the inclusive continental was good, lots of choice. Friendly service, good value for money would really really recommed it,

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: u600213
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayflower Hotel because they offered a very good rate to a meeting planner and someone else was paying for my stay. On arrival I was given a room on the top floor which overlooked the rail tracks and was extremely warm/hot. The room was also extremely small. I went down to reception and asked for and received a different room facing away from the tracks. It was equally small. So small that I had to place my 21inch roller bag on the bed to open it, and had to store the bag closed in an upright position. There was a built-in desk but the bed was so close to it that I could not move the chair back to sit in it. I had to stand in front of the desk and move the chair sideways till it was behind me, then sit and reverse to get up. The bathroom was equally small. Water was hot but pressure in shower was low. I had to unplug something to get a free outlet for my laptop. The Hotel has an elevator which is also very small and very slow. One person and one roller bag can fit in it at once. Free WiFi is offered in the lobby but I received a signal in my room too. Continental Breakfast included cold cereals, some whole fruit in a bowl, rolls and bread, and sliced cheese, tomatoes and cucumbers along with juices and coffee and tea. Full cooked to order breakfast was offered at additional charge but I didn't try it. The hotel staff were nice, the hotel was very clean, the location was convenient but the rooms are too small.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the Internet Page”
Reviews.Author: BobM51
Reviews.Content: We booked a Mayflower Apartment as an alternative to staying five nights in a small hotel room. We were taken from the Hotel to an under street "cave" on Warwick Road by a surly staff member, who thankfully, I did not have to deal with again. The room,(â€œapartmentâ€�) which had one small window and was accessed through 3 locked doors was cramped and hot. A noisy fan was the only form of ventilation. The double bed was squeezed into an alcove and a large amount of space was taken up by a "cupboard" housing the hot water cylinder. Pots and pans were provided but no stove top ?? The bathroom was at least, clean and modern. Location only a couple of doors away from the entrance to Earls Court tube station was a bonus. A disappointing welcome to London and I would recommend that travellers request some details of the apartment before confirming a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nenny21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for four nights to do some sightseeing in London. I booked the Mayflower because I had read a review in the Telegraph which said it was good value for money. We found it to be excellent in every respect. We had a friendly welcome from the receptionists and were told we had been upgraded to an executive room at no extra cost. The room was quite spacious with a very nice bathroom which included a good size corner shower. We could not work out how the safe worked and without any quibbles the receptionist sent a porter to show us. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed comfortable. The self service buffet continental breakfast was plentiful and excellent. The proximity to Earls Court tube station makes the Mayflower a good choice for exploring London and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: MrsWright2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my first visit to the UK in 2003. At the time the hotel seemed to be going through some upgrades. I stayed in a double room and found it to be small but adequate. The decor was modern and comfortable. The bathrooms were beautifully done and modern. The location is just a stones throw to the Earls Court tube station. I would stay here again. It is in a safe area and the rooms were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: jules68aberdeen
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Hotel and Apartments in London are magnificent. I booked my family of 5, 2 adults and 3 children in to an apartment via another website. What a surprise I got when we arrived. The reception is absolutely gorgeous and under my breath I was saying to my husband there must have been a mistake because this couldn't be where we were staying for the price I was quoted. Well in a way I was right although free to use the hotels facilities our apartment was just across the street. Another terrific surprise. Penthouse living at it's best. My family were overjoyed. The place was immaculate and kept that way by an excellent maid service the whole week. We were in London to do the whole tourist experience and th Mayflower is an excellent base for just that. Situated 1 street away from Earl's Court tube station we had easy access to all of London's top attractions. If we felt like an evening in we had everything in the neighbourhood. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Please consider carefully before staying here”
Reviews.Author: aaq_1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to stay the night before a vital exam in Earls Court. I had read reviews on Trip Advisor and contacted the hotel directly to make a booking specifically identifying my need for a quiet room in preparation for the exam. I was confirmed a double room for single occupancy. On my arrival late in the evening, I was informed that I in fact was not booked into a room, but was in an 'apartment'. This apartment I found to be in a basement flat, away from the hotel, adjacent to Earls Court Station. There was a constant noise of trains. The room was clean. There was no phone in the room which presented increased difficulty due to poor mobile reception in a basement room. At around midnight the occupants of the adjacent flat came and thin walls meant all the noise from their flat kept me awake until 4.30 am. In addition to the trains and the adjacent occupants, at around 1am there were people ringing the doorbell which sounded in both flats. The lack of a room phone meant I could not communicate with the hotel reception. The most disturbing aspect was the response of the hotel management who instead of an apology for misleading me about what it was that I was booking into, said all they could have done is to refund my money if I'd checked out at 1am. I explained that nowhere to stay, at 1am, on the streets around Earls Court, with an exam marking the end of my surgical training in the morning was the absolute worse of all situations. However there was not even the slightest of empathy. I was most upset by the attitude of the management, I feel with good justification. More than anything else, it is this that would make me urge anyone thinking about staying here, to reconsider

Reviews.Title: “Mice”
Reviews.Author: RenoTommy
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was pretty decent for 3 budget travelers at 99GBP/night - breakfast inc.; except there were mice in the rooms. I believe, mice were everywhere in London so for an old building like the Mayflower, having the critters running around was no surprise. We especially liked the convenient location to almost every business that we could think of........ restaurants, 7/11, fish & chips, photo studio (you need 2 photos to purchase the underground pass), travel agencies, even a couple of mini casinos, etc & etc. Hotel clerks were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, most of the waitpersons serving our breakfast couldn't speak English. They were international exchange students and one came from as far as Mongolia!

Reviews.Title: “scary, small”
Reviews.Author: tdnadz
Reviews.Content: While this may be a typical hotel style in London (I usually stay at high-end hotels) I was not only surprised but scared at times. I should probably mention here that it was our first trip to London. We were greeted by 3 very quiet, somber middle-eastern gentlemen complete with turbans. It was obvious we interrupted a conversation of sorts when we checked in. Needless to say it was uncomfortable to say the least. Once we checked in we attempted to take our luggage up to our room. Operatiave word here is "attempted". The elevators (lifts) were the size of a vertical coffin (for 2). Yup - that's it. Seeing as we were traveling throughout the UK for 2 weeks, we had some luggage, so it took 2 trips EACH up the lift to our 2nd coffin - the large closet with a bed - yea, that was our room. The mattress was all of 3 inches thick, minimal closet space (not a biggie for me, but may be for some of you). I'll spare you the rest of the details, but you can imagine. The room was clean, I do have to admit that. The bath, also, was clean. And, breakfast (complimentary) was served in the basement level. It really wasn't bad. Upon leaving the hotel, we asked the front desk to call us a cab. A large Mercedes pulled up, (aparently a private hire car) a man speaking broken English (perhaps a nephew of the owner?) got out of the car and started putting our luggage in the trunk. We followed (again, we were green!), got in the car and told him to take us to Charring Cross train station. That was the longest ride of my life (all of 4 miles!). I actually caught the driver glaring at me via the rear-view window. Stupidly (isn't hind-sight 20/20?) I "glared" right back. It's a wonder I'm alive. Mind you, I'm the last one to consider myself biased or prejudice, but this was a true test amongst extreme cultures. If this doesn't type of trave doesn't bother you, feel free to stay - the place was clean - just made me very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: pjdatwork
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at this hotel fairly last minute. On arrival at Earls Court tube sation we realised we had stayed in another hotel in the area a couple of years ago and it was dreafully, o it was some sense of foreboding that we made our way to The Mayflower. The street gave no clues to how good the hotel is. The location is central and its easy to get around on the tube system, there are also plenty of fair-good eating places in easy walking distance. The hotel reception was clean and modernan d the receptio staff welcoming. Our room was on the first floor at the front of the hotel so it had a small balcony. The lift was remarkably small, only or 4 persons and once upstairs it is a maze of small the corridors, some extra signage would be helpful. Our double room was small but had everything we needed.It was beautifully clean, well decorated and furnished and we were exceptionaly comfortable. The bathrom was just the right size with a walk in and efficient shower. Overall we were very impressed and would not hesitate to stay at the Mayflower again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: donfar
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic!!!! My husband, myself and our 2 daughters (ages 19 & 24) stayed at the Mayflower for 9 days in June. It was extremely difficult to find a room in London that would hold 4 adults for a resonable price. My husband and I had traveled in England before and knew that the hotel rooms are notoriously small as compared to the US so I was a little concerned about the amount of space we would have. We had a room in the main hotel, in the basement just down the hall from the breakfast room. The room was fairly quiet and much larger that we had expected. We had 2 double beds and there was plenty of closet space. There was a desk and 2 chairs in the room and we still had sufficient room to move around. The bath was unusually large with double sinks. The only anoyance was that the bathroom exhaust fan was poor and when more that 2 people took a shower the room became humid and muggy. The room did have a stand fan supplied that helped with that problem. We were at the front of the hotel and since we were in the basement our windows where below street level. They were frosted so that nobody could see in but that meant the we could not see out to check the weather until we left the room. We spent so little time in the room that this was not that big of a deal. Being in the front of the hotel also meant the we didn't have the annoyance of hearing the underground as other reviewers have mentioned. We also had a computer and took advantage of the wireless internet. We had no trouble getting connected and communicating with people back home.The complimentary breakfast became a little boring after the 4th day but it was filling and it was one less meal you had to buy. They had cereal, yoguart, fruit, cheese, crossaints, rolls, toast, juice, coffee and tea. You could order extra (eggs, etc) for an extra fee.The very best thing about the Mayflower was the proximity to the Earl's Court Underground station!!! It is litteraly around the corner! At the other end of the street was Earl's Court Road with a couple of grocery stores that were a good place to buy snacks and many eating places including Subway and some cute taverns. There is a great pizza place called Snappy Pizza, the pizza was really good. While I can't really call the prices a bargin (nothing in London is a bargin with the currency exchange as it is now) our experience with the Mayflower hotel was very good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Scam -- beware!!”
Reviews.Author: mvelando
Reviews.Content: We booked a night in this hotel using the property website. As we checked-in, we were asked to pay for the night in advance, which seemed weird (as other hotels bill you when you check-out). After we paid, we were told we had been assigned a studio in a property next door, because the hotel was full. We were told the studios were more spacious and luxurious than regular rooms (?). A hotel employee showed us the way, to a building on the street in front of the hotel. As soon as he opened the door of the building we could see we were in for a disaster: The building was old, not well maintained and with poor light. We were shown our studio, which was just TERRIBLE -- the furniture was old, the carpet was dirty and smelly, the bed was oddly positioned on a split level, etc, etc, etc. I knew I was not going to be able to sleep there so we went back to the reception and asked for another room, preferably in the hotel. We were told there were no other rooms and that the one we've seen was the only one available. We decided to leave and ask for refund to try our luck and go to another hotel and to our SHOCK, we were told that they could not give us a refund (of the money we had juts paid 10 minutes ago) because they had offered us a room. Unbelievable. We argue with one of the ungraceful employees in the reception desk but he said we will had to go back next day to discuss that with the manager as he was not authorized to give us a refund. We could not believe that was happening in London, and we felt were part of a SCAM. In a nutshell, we left the hotel and spent the night at another one. We are still waiting for our 135 pounds refund. LESSON: DON"T EVEN DARE TO GET CLOSE TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Small but still perfect!”
Reviews.Author: piperpro
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect - it is literally just around the corner from the Earl's Court tube station and Earl's court exhibition halls.
